column4: Is there an easy way to install vlc on Ubuntu? I use VLC on every other computer, so I want to use it here, too.
enable all your repos and vlc awaits
ubotu has gifted you with lots of info
OK. Thanks!
keep religion and swearing out of the channel please
please dont use "easyubuntu"
then congratulations!
why cant they?
with the proper libs, totem can play any a/v media
Well, screw that. You SHOULD be able to play music out of the box. Even WINDOWS does that. Or at the least it should tell you why not.
windows pays royalties
It just gives a generic error.
I KNOW!
It SHOULD give a decent error message though. like "Oops! I can't play MP3s, check out http://wiki.ubuntu.com/wiki/RestrictedFormats for more information."
that is a good idea
a terminal? many of them
or maybe you mean 'dosemu' to emulate an actuall dos environment
There is such a thing?
yes watch ubotu
That wasn't what I ment, but that would be sweet! (I like Lemmings!)
hit alt-f2 and type "xkill" the next window you touch, dies
